BrowserActionTitle.description: Title for the browser action that's visible to the user of extension
BrowserActionTitle.message: Capture the web page with WebScrapBook

ErrorCaptureGeneral.message: See browser console for more detail.

ErrorContentScriptNotReady.message: The content script is not ready or cannot be loaded. Refresh this page, wait for all elements to be loaded, and try again.

ExtensionDescription.description: Description of the extension as it's visible to the outside world
ExtensionDescription.message: Captures the web page with highly customizable configurations.

ExtensionName.description: Name of the extension as it's visible to the outside world

OptionCaptureCommonBlankTooltip.message: Keep the element but disable its link or content.

OptionCaptureCommonLinkTooltip.message: Rewrite the referenced link to its source. Note that this will trigger a network flow when browsing the captured document in the future.

OptionCaptureCommonSaveTooltip.message: Save the referenced object to local.

OptionCaptureCommonRemoveTooltip.message: Remove the element. Note that this could affect the layout.

OptionCaptureDataFolderTooltip.message: All captured data will be saved to this subfolder.

OptionCaptureRecordDocumentMetaTooltip.message: Record metadata such as source URL in the outermost html element.

OptionCaptureRecordRemovedAttrTooltip.message: If an attribute is removed during the capture process, create a corresponding data-* attribute to record its original value.

OptionCaptureRecordErrorUriTooltip.message: If connection to a URL failed during the capture process, record it as urn:scrapbook:*. If unchecked, link to the source address (which could still be unavailable and be an invalid connection).

OptionCaptureRecordRemovedNodeTooltip.message: If an element is removed during the capture process, create a comment in place to record its original content.

OptionCaptureRecordSourceUriTooltip.message: If a URL is rewritten during the capture process, create a corresponding data-* attribute to record its original address.

OptionCaptureRemoveIntegrityTooltip.message: The content of captured object could be rewritten during the capture process. Not removing the integrity attribute will make them unloadable.

OptionCaptureSaveAsDownloadsTooltip.message: Save captured data into an auto-generated folder via a stream of downloads. (For Chrome, it's recommended that "Ask where to save each file before downloading" be unchecked to avoid tons of prompts.)

OptionCaptureSaveAsciiFilenameTooltip.message: The captured file will have non-ASCII chars in the filename encoded.

OptionCaptureSaveAsTooltip.message: Determine how to save captured data. .htz and .maff files can be viewed via "View archived page" or via unzipping it.

OptionCaptureSaveAsMaffTooltip.message: Pack web pages and their referenced resources as a .maff file using the standard zip algorithm.

OptionCaptureSaveAsSingleHtmlTooltip.message: Save the captured web page as a single HTML file. Referenced resources are stored as data URI and can be viewed in most modern browsers.

OptionCaptureSaveAsZipTooltip.message: Pack a web page and its referenced resources as a .htz file using the standard zip algorithm.

OptionCaptureSaveDataUriAsFileTooltip.message: A filename will be auto-generated according to the MIME type and the SHA-1 hash of the content of the data URI.

OptionCaptureSaveFileAsHtmlTooltip.message: Save a browser-viewable non-HTML file as an HTML web page.

OptionCaptureSavePromptLabel.message: Ask where to save each captured pack:

OptionCaptureSavePromptTooltip.message: This does not applied when saving as downloads.

OptionCaptureSaveSelectionOnlyTooltip.message: When checked, only the selected area will be captured.

OptionCaptureScriptAttrTooltip.message: Attributes that triggers a script, such as onclick.

WarnCaptureCyclicRefercing.message: Resource '$SOURCE$' has a circular reference to '$TARGET$', which will be blanked because current capture configuration does not support circular reference.
